and done
@rasahner Can we just make sure the RT node still works and doesn't throw any weird exceptions with this change?
After that, I'm :+1:. Commits need to be squashed still

@drcrallen removed the new ServerConfig setting and doing log.debug(..) instead
@fjy updated the doc about setting "io.druid.jetty.RequestLog" to debug level for printing request logs.
@pdeva Thanks for this catch
Current statement is "Converts runtime.properties files from version to version"

I was able to start the realtime node wikipedia_realtime.spec and watched it ingest events. 
Commits are squashed.
Doesn't look like https://github.com/druid-io/druid/commit/e055a7e86927e925f4326ba7eeec0b946b203a70#diff-20dd34b3436d47fb2bd5c2f3d144fae2 was included in any 0.7 release, interestingly enough.
Actually https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1024 and https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1323 seem to indicate that commit has been having trouble overall.
Looking at code I believe that is actually correct for what it is doing. See https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/1562 for more information

Looking at overall commit history,

https://github.com/druid-io/druid/commit/f811c8d1ad43c1b53ab8683c1747cd0bc33fcbe3

was immediately before 
https://github.com/metamx/druid/commit/a1689bc9069c59db227936d41d092f3705ed293a
from the branch
https://github.com/metamx/druid/commits/propertiesUpdater
and merged into master via https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1024

The commit
https://github.com/druid-io/druid/commit/021a7de759ef9a58a285bd7c7d98b7a737055c51

Is immediately after what should have been #1024 .

Sometime between January ~13 and January ~20th (when 0.7.0 was cut) it vanished from master. It was noticed that the commit had vanished and it was added back via https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1323 to master, my best guess is that it wasn't noticed missing from the 0.7 line. Why it went missing will probably remain a mystery for a while.
interesting history, Looks like commit f7ea308 came in manually without a PR, probably a forced push and got a1689bc906 removed
:+1: I am also having the same issue.
If this was working before, we should find out when that regression happened. @guobingkun what's the last version you ran where this worked?
@xvrl 0.8.0 - Stable is the latest version that works.
LGTM (again with the caveat in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1469#issuecomment-119342253 )
@guobingkun any chance you can git bisect and find the offending commit?
@himanshug yeah probably my fault from a few months ago. AFAIK things should be okay with 0.8.0 right?
Java 8 + zk atomicity seems keeps breaking, trying for a better travis CI run
Suspected to be problem with permissions. Once verified will close.
I recall looking into this issue with @xvrl awhile ago and I thought it repaired though
There's some Guice problems with resolving shardSpec types for the tool. One workaround is to remove the shardSpec and add it in manually after the conversion.
Ditto that.
As noted in the bug report, I did remove the shardSpec and ran into further errors

@pdeva You'll have to include the kafka 8 extension for the tool to be able to resolve the type. I think we will need more tests around the tool. You can also read http://druid.io/docs/latest/ingestion/realtime-ingestion.html and manually convert the spec.
Sounds good to me, let's make sure we include @himanshug 's caveat in the release notes.
@xvrl Sure, let me investigate.

There was a question as to why certain namespace types exist. Here's a brief rundown:
- `uri` : What we will be using. Takes a flat data file and parses it with a parseSpec whose formats are supported as per the drui-api `ParseSpec`s. This one operates on a polling interval to look for a new data file to download.
- `kafka`: This one instantly propagates changes.
- `jdbc`: This one is only there because I kept getting requests to have a way to read the data through a jdbc connection. It function very similarly to the `uri` case except it pulls from a DB.

The question was if a kafka extension is really needed. It is the only way to instantly propagate a change through the cluster in the current collection of ways to propagate data. If that is deemed not required then it is pretty easy to pull out the extension.
Thanks @pdeva !
LGTM ( assuming there are UTs already covering this )

@himanshug yes, there are a couple of unit tests in CachingClusteredClient for this code. It used to be that this code was trying to take some shortcuts to optimize merging, in case the data was already ordered, but it turns that that only works if there are no gaps in all the segments. We've fixed those bugs and added tests over time, and now it turns out the complexity that resulted from trying to optimize things is no longer needed and may even hurt performance.
@fjy @drcrallen can you please see and thumbs-up/merge if there are no further comments?

:+1: Looks very nice. With log4j2 you should be able to open up a jconsole to the jvm with the log4j2 plugin and enable logging dynamically if you wanted to be really fancy on the operational side of this feature.

@himanshug Do you want to squash?
@drcrallen squashed
this looks related to  #1568 , would you like to bring all the changes in one PR and squash?

@himanshug I had considered that, but having them as separate commits makes reverting very clean if any particular one needs reverted for some reason. I can, however, migrate this one to the other PR if it is desired. Though they are so small merging would be quicker
LGTM
Fixed by https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1571/files
@fjy Can this branch be deleted?
@michaelschiff Is this resolved?
@xvrl I dont know what they are. Can you add them?
@drcrallen yep, merged in my pull-request
@gbarton What command are you running to get this error?

We have a thin wrapper around aether to pull deps from maven artifacts down into our artifactory.  That is whats coughing up on the parent pom.  I have nearly 12,000 artifacts in my artifactory and never seen this before.
I have browsed the pom files and don't see any obvious place where this is coming from. The parent pom looks reasonable to me.  Where are you building the tar from?
@gbarton are you using pull-deps in druid or an external aether client?
External aether client.  I could be doing something dumb within it, just never came across this error before.

You can check out Druid's pull-deps command as per http://druid.io/docs/latest/tutorials/tutorial-a-first-look-at-druid.html#making-maven-druid-dependencies-available-offline And if that is broken please let us know. Additionally, if you find something about the way that druid packages things that breaks aether or maven specifications, then I would also be very interested in knowing about it.

For releases, the procedure at https://github.com/druid-io/oss-parent  is followed.

Unfortunately, external aether clients cannot be supported unless there's something that Druid is doing that breaks a specification. Closing until there is more evidence that there is a problem with the druid build system. At which point this should most definitely be reopened.

how does one add kafka extension to classpath? there is no documentation for this.
in druid 0.6 we add the kafka extension as a maven style dependency in runtime.properties file.
since runtime.properties is not being used here, how do i add the extension?
closing/reopening for rebuild

It is possible to override `druid.indexer.runner.javaOpts` at the middle manager or overlord level, but again, all options need to be included, and the library needs to support a `-Dlog4j.configurationFile` config options. And such properties must be used for ALL peons.

@b-slim your PR description mentions "Unit Test for exractionFn with empty result", however, if I understand correctly this would be a violation of the ExtractionFn contract, which explicitly states that an ExtractionFn should always return null, and never return empty string. Maybe I am missing something?
Thanks @KurtYoung, do you quickly filling out our CLA form at http://druid.io/community/cla.html, so we can merge this? Thanks!
LGTM
@xvrl i have updated the test name, it is true that empty result is confusing
done
@KurtYoung Thanks for the contrib!
@fjy Glad to help, wish to contribute more

@OrRon Thanks for this info. Where did you go to look at up the first tutorial? We recently changed the default metadata store to be derby to avoid having to set up another dependency. The information for MySQL should still be a part of the 0.8.0 docs
@fjy I went to look for the first tutorial in the docs and in druid.io. I did work on druid 0.8.0 it was the last stable one.

@himanshug No, it didn't work

@onlychoice yeah, I guess I never noticed it bcoz things worked with default settings for the examples.

thanks for the contrib, can you please sign the cla at http://druid.io/community/cla.html ?

@himanshug , I created 'druid' user and granted privileges to it. Then I kept getting  sql errors. First I logged in and created druid db. Then the error changed to missing table. This was only solved after I added this flash. Also i made sure manually it open the tables.

I'm new to this code so there's a good chance I missed something. However, even if it is still default, I believe it's worth mentioning a little more details about the mysql connection

@OrRon thanks for trying out and fighting your way through. For those unnecessary complications to new users, we have changed the example to use derby instead which requires no setup by the user. that change will reflect in 0.8.1 release, things will hopefully be better then.
However, given that default value for createTable is true, I think the change proposed in this PR is not necessary.
@OrRon  also we have added more mysql specific notes in the latest docs https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1571/files .
@himanshug That looks really good!

druid.db.connector.validationQuery

This is super rad. :+1: Deleting lines FWIW!
Looks good but druid-console needs to be released
@drcrallen if you merge it I can release it :)
@cheddar please kindly check the new changes
@gianm i took care of all the review comments( except the one related to talking to overlord instead of metadata store for getting list of segments) in last 2 commits, pls take a look.

@himanshug, those changes look good to me. Have you had a chance to try them out on an actual hadoop job? And do you have any thoughts on the overlord thing? The only thing that really comes to mind for me is something involving a wrapper interface (that just has a listUsedSegments method) that is provided differently based on whether we're a peon or an overlord.

@gianm yeah, I'm thinking of creating an interface "ListUsedSegments" inside indexing-hadoop and create 2 implementations of it inside indexing-service (one based on overlord action, other based on directly metadata store). We would bind appropriate implementation in CliXXX.java and have DatasourcePathspec ingest ListUsedSegments interface.
I had tested the previous version of code with (unfortunately keeping "name" and "fieldName" same in the aggregators). Once we're ok with code, I will test everything again on hadoop before squashing the commits etc.

https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/indexing-hadoop/src/main/java/io/druid/indexer/HadoopDruidIndexerJob.java#L68 suggests that happens already by default because https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/indexing-hadoop/src/main/java/io/druid/indexer/LegacyIndexGeneratorJob.java would get used.

ok, have implemented both..
1) using overlord action vs metadata store for getting used segment list https://github.com/druid-io/druid/commit/e0ff9909453b07692cf412298c06ce0eca59c067
2) differentiating InputRow from existing segments while serialization and using combining aggregators https://github.com/himanshug/druid/commit/344f6b058770b2ae3ac8d799864f34d04c775eaa

@gianm @cheddar pls take a look and let me know if they are ok. I still need to test the new code with these changes, will do that before creating final squashed version.
@himanshug good point :) in accordance with keeping the prior behavior of merge on heap I'm closing this.
LGTM, some benchmarks or indication it resolved the issue you were seeing would be good though
Squash and I'm :+1:
@onlychoice Thanks for this catch. We are looking and will update this issue.
The rollup isn't captured in the segment metadata right now. However, we are adding support for this. This is actually a duplicate of https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/1514
@MarConSchneid do you think you can submit a PR for this fix?
@onlychoice are you adding hadoop libs directly on the classpath or you're getting them by putting hdfs-storage extension in the druid configuration?
